intro: Acer chingii, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, Acer chingii is often cultivated in gardens and parks.
